summary: Digital real estate tools can streamline the homebuying process, from house shopping online to getting a mortgage approved faster. But these property technologies carry risks. For example, their use of artificial intelligence can make it harder to comply with fair lending laws. Mortgage lenders evaluating borrowers largely use property technology systems from Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac—major enterprises in the housing finance markets. But the...
title: Property Technology for Homebuying: Products Present Benefits and Risks Amid Evolving Federal Oversight
